Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Organizer \Or"gan*i`zer\, n. One who organizes. [1913 Webster]

organizer n 1: a person who brings order and organization to an enterprise [syn: {organiser}, {arranger}] 2: someone who enlists workers to join a union [syn: {organiser}, {labor organizer}] 3: a lightweight consumer electronic device that looks like a hand-held computer but instead performs specific tasks; can serve as a diary or a personal database or a telephone or an alarm clock etc. [syn: {personal digital assistant}, {PDA}, {personal organizer}, {personal organiser}, {organiser}]
